reviews.review_msg: Hands down the best prof I have ever got in my 2 years undergrad experience. Dustin is my kingg!

I highly recommend taking a course w/ dr.king!! Great guy, not a bad thing to say about him. I def recommend that if u can tach ochem1 first, taking them at the same time can be really hard since everything will require at adequate understanding of ochem and many fall behind bc of it

Dustin is the goat. Great guy once you get to know him and always willing to help in office hours. MBB 222 is a dense course but he does well to concise it and try and make the course interesting for students. pay attention to his lectures and slides and you should be good to go. I would take any course with him for sure
Honestly goated prof. Very clear what you needed to know and exams were super fair. Assignments were not too difficult either.
Amazing prof, def would love to take again if possible, hope he teaches more upper level courses in the future.

10/10 prof. Lots of content and lec heavy, but does an amazing job at simplyifying all of it. Final was harder than the midterms, but expected due to a lot more in depth content, still fair though if you studied. Never did anything extra (office hours, tutorting, tutorials,etc.) only listened to lecs and did amazing in the class

There are a lot of notes to take from lecture, so I recommend taking notes on top of the lecture slides if possible. The textbook isn't totally necessary, but helpful if you want to perform really well. The exams are pretty reasonable, but also very very rushed, so watch out for that!

Dr. King is one of the kindest, most knowledgeable, and accessible profs there are at SFU. The bad reviews he gets are because MBB 222 is a really dense course no matter how you go about it. Get your CHEM 281 first to help you survive. I had to put in work for this course and went to my TA's office hours every week but in the end, it was worth it.
He is a very considerate professor and he explains things very clearly. The class itself isn't easy but he's a fair marker so if you study enough you'll do fine.

You need to go to class and actually pay attention because he tends to focus on specific topics that you can't get from the lecture slides alone and those things WILL pop up on the exam. The only thing about his testing is you get 40 MINS for both midterms, and that is NOT ENOUGH but other than that his tests are pretty fair. Don't fall behind

this is the first time im writing a ratemyprof review and its just because dr king was literally the best!! i was initially nervous about taking the class because of the reviews but honestly if you study his slides (know them well) this class won't be too bad. it is content heavy, yes, but dr. king made it really interesting and I loved it!

I took this course at the same time as chem281 and found the first exam quite difficult, as the material requires a decent amount of understanding of Ochem. However, Dr. King explains concepts well and I was able to get my grade up later on. Lots of memorization for a lot of material, and a huge time crunch for midterms.

you can tell this guy enjoy what we studies and teaches. Very good at explaining difficult concepts and even records lectures to look back on just in case. His practices midterms can appear “easier” than the actual midterms, but the only thing i didnt enjoy were the time crunches made for the exams. Other than that, great dude!

Dr. King was an amazing professor. He's very passionate about what he teaches, which allows him to teach the material really well. He tests based on what he teaches and emphasizes, and is really clear on what you need to know

Dr King is a nice guy who seems to be very knowledgeable about the topics, as he answered every question asked in class. The two midterms are very time-crunchy with there only being 40 minutes. The final is the same format, just with 3 hours so it gives you time to review your work. MBB 222 has too much content, but I think Dr King did a good job.

I'm taking chem 281 with this course so I feel like it may distort my perception on him. Honestly, the tests are decently fair but there is so much content and a little more than half an hour to finish the midterms (which i hate) I often have to fight for my grade to get above average so I wouldn't recommend mbb 222 as a co req w/ chem 281

Explains so clearly, great lecturer, very charismatic. Exams are fair enough, though there are sometimes small bits out of nowhere that were not focused on in lecture. Overall great prof, relatively fair exams.

Dr kings classes have a good atmosphere and his lectures can be engaging if you're interested in the subject. the midterms are fair,doesn't have enough time but you can get a good grade if you go over the lecture materials thoroughly. Final was harder than the midterms, more challenging questions. Overall would recommend taking this course with him

He is a great professor, he seems very passionate about what he teaches. The course itself is very heavy on material so you are going to have to memorize a lot of things. His tests are not too hard but you do need to study a lot for them. Overall really good professor.
Excellent lectures and very approachable. If you work hard and commit to learning the material you will do very well in this course. Assessments are very fair and straight forward.

overall a nice person. doesnt know how to teach "everything is testable" practice mts r nothing like the actual midterms just memorize everything in his slides dont even try to understnad cuz you wont.

Prof King is a great lecturer and explains all material very well. Course is super loaded with material and practice midterms are not a reflection of what exam will be like. Exams are pretty tough and require a lot of attention to each MC question.

Did so bad on the 2 midterms but I locked in for the final. All you need is hard work and dedicate your soul to studying. Lecture heavy, too many things to memorize. Overall I think he is good at teaching and would recommend him if you actually put in the work.

Difficult and not good at teaching. Does Not respond to emails regardless of email subject. Tests dont give students enough time and questions are unnecessarily confusing. Overall would avoid if possible.

nice guy but horrible prof. he expects us to memorize so much bc "everything is testable". his practice mts were way easier and nothing like the actual mts so don't think ur ready when ur actually not esp bc his mts are only 40 minutes long with 40 marks.

He is a nice person. However, slides are loaded with so much information and he will never say what to study or focus more on for exams. He will just say everything is testable and then memorizing all that he puts on his slides is hell.

a lot of details to remember, anything in the slides or that he talked about can be on the exam, don't fall behind, and mock exams are usually a lot easier than the real exams. very passionate and likeable guy though

Decent professor that provides lecture recordings and seems passionate about his stuff. Course is densely packed with details so try to remember most of it bc "everything can be tested". 40 minute midterms were very rushed, but the final was not too bad.

MBB is a heavy content course, and while King tried his best to teach it, its hard to stay focused in his class for the whole semester. His exams are 40 mins long which is kinda short for the amount of questions he gives us. 6/10 prof.

Passionate, enthusiastic, and seems to enjoy teaching the course. The course is very material-heavy: lots of information to learn and understand. Midterms are only 40 minutes long which in my opinion, is too short. The extra 10 minutes can help obtain better marks. Slides are very dense, many of them containing unnecessary information.

Lectures are very dense so it can get tough to stay focused the whole time but Dr King does a good job going through the material thoroughly. Very receptive and encouraging to questions during lecture. Tests are very detail oriented and will get very specific.

Lectures may be dry but if you pay attention, he explains things really well. Listen to lecture recordings if you run out of time to study! Read the textbk if you can. Exams were generally not too difficult for me. MT2 was a lil tricky but I expected it to be so as it was all multiple choice (due to strike). I can tell he cares for his students!

professor King is amazing considering that it was his first semester teaching I think he was wonderful. I must say his first midterm was light work and then he DUCKED US UP with the second midterm it was very difficult but then his third was ok. ALL IM SAYING IS ACTUALLY understand everything on his slides thats ur way to an A. His final is fair.

This was Dr. King's first semester as a prof and I really enjoyed his class. You can tell he loves his field. 
I recommend listening back to the lecture recordings and using the textbook as an extra resource. I wouldn't say he's a tough marker but he wants understanding. He tests content taught the class before the midterm but overall he's fair.

Nice guy overall and his first year teaching. Seems really in the topics. His midterm averages were listed in another rating. His second midterm was definitely unfair and should have been graded less as it was during TA strikes and it was all MC. Otherwise the average would have been about 65%. Definitely try to keep up but overall is very fair.
He's nice, hard midterms especially the multiple choice. The averages for the 3 midterms were 73.6%, 57.8% and  67.5%.
Dustin was a great prof, fair midterms but course is VERY content heavy. Be prepared to read and study.
Our king :) good bless this man he is so slay :) 100% recommend but get rdy to read cuz his slides are full of pictures and diagrams

Dr.King is one of the sweetest most caring professors I have ever had. His first and third midterm were very fair and his second was hell on earth ( I was mad) but generally speaking he is rdy to answer all ur Qs and he is super nice so reach out if u need help. The sweetest man alive. If u wanna succeed then read ur  textbook

All the midterms were quite hard and had lots of info that could be from textbook or lecture. This course is very content heavy so be prepared to study a lot. Practice midterms provided were much easier than the midterms so dont be fooled.

The first midterm was just O-chem review, the second midterm was just hard as it was all challenging mc and the third final was a bit better than the second one. This is not an easy course, keep up and use your TAs for help. Practice midterms make you think you're ready when you're not actually ready for the midterm's level of difficulty.
Lots of reading because material can be pulled from textbook for midterms. Dustin is a great prof and answers questions clearly but can be boring at times in lecture.

A researcher maybe, an instructor? No. Was not able to convey ideas clearly and focused too heavily on memorization especially considering the course was supposed to be concept based. I ended up getting an A- without ever taking a single note in his class, relying purely on self-study sessions.

Prof is really passionate about his field, and I believe works hard to ensure the success of his students. He tries to make this class seem interesting, as material is quite dry. Notes are detailed but not overly so. That being said, it's unfortunate that his thick french accent makes it very hard to understand him. Avoid if you can't self study.

If you have trouble paying attention in class or making your own notes I advise to stay away from this prof. The TA in this class is what saved my grade and he most likely wrote the exams which were ok. I am not sure if this prof will teach again as there were other profs in his lectures marking what he was doing which is never good. Thick accent!
Decent prof. Hard to understand but it doesnt matter just study on your own and youll be fine. exams are straight from lecture notes, problem sets and tutorial questions.

Avoid this prof if you can. Lectures were extremely boring due to his monotone voice and French accent. Lecture slides get posted before lecture and are complete, but they are basically copy and pasted from the textbook and lengthy.. definitely not 'notes'. Seems like he's passionate about the material, but not interested in teaching.

Dr. Pio is a decent professor, he knows his stuff, and he's very intellectual with his teaching. He's not the one who makes up the exams, it's his TA's. With that said, the course material is very dense and dry, and you need to study in order to understand. The TA's do a good job of conferring exam-related info. Other than that, course is okay.

AT ALL COSTS, DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS WITH HIM. He may be the worst prof I have ever encountered, in terms of teaching ability and understanding. His french accent is such a determent, which can be incredibly hard for many people to understand.  His ability to imply the concept of each lecture is terribly weak.

Save yourself the time and DO NOT TAKE THE CLASS WITH HIM! Terrible prof, cannot understand him at all in class and makes material very confusing. His notes are impossible to understand which makes it even worse... The guy seems like he just wants to do research and doesn't care about teaching
